34 #include "../include/CCGNSMeshReaderFVM.hpp"
35 #include "../include/CRectangularMeshReaderFVM.hpp"
36 #include "../include/CBoxMeshReaderFVM.hpp"
37 #include "../include/CMultiGridQueue.hpp"
38 #include <iomanip>

40 #include <sys/stat.h>
41 #include <iterator>
42 #ifdef _MSC_VER
43 #include <direct.h>
44 #endif
45 
46 /*--- Epsilon definition ---*/
47 
48 #define EPSILON 0.000001
49 
50 /*--- Cross product ---*/
51 
52 #define CROSS(dest,v1,v2) \
53 (dest)[0] = (v1)[1]*(v2)[2] - (v1)[2]*(v2)[1]; \
54 (dest)[1] = (v1)[2]*(v2)[0] - (v1)[0]*(v2)[2]; \
55 (dest)[2] = (v1)[0]*(v2)[1] - (v1)[1]*(v2)[0];
56 
57 /*--- Cross product ---*/
58 
59 #define DOT(v1,v2) ((v1)[0]*(v2)[0] + (v1)[1]*(v2)[1] + (v1)[2]*(v2)[2]);
60 
61 /*--- a = b - c ---*/
62 
63 #define SUB(dest,v1,v2) \
64 (dest)[0] = (v1)[0] - (v2)[0]; \
65 (dest)[1] = (v1)[1] - (v2)[1]; \
66 (dest)[2] = (v1)[2] - (v2)[2];
67 
68 CGeometry::CGeometry(void) {
69 
70  size = SU2_MPI::GetSize();
71  rank = SU2_MPI::GetRank();
72 
73  nEdge = 0;
74  nPoint = 0;
75  nPointNode = 0;
76  nElem = 0;
77 
78  nElem_Bound = NULL;
79  Tag_to_Marker = NULL;
80  elem = NULL;
81  face = NULL;
82  bound = NULL;
83  node = NULL;
84  edge = NULL;
85  vertex = NULL;
86  nVertex = NULL;
87  newBound = NULL;
88  nNewElem_Bound = NULL;
89  Marker_All_SendRecv = NULL;
90 
91  XCoordList.clear();
92  Xcoord_plane.clear();
93  Ycoord_plane.clear();
94  Zcoord_plane.clear();
95  FaceArea_plane.clear();
96  Plane_points.clear();
97 
98  /*--- Arrays for defining the linear partitioning ---*/
99 
100  beg_node = NULL;
101  end_node = NULL;
102 
103  nPointLinear = NULL;
104  nPointCumulative = NULL;
105 
106  /*--- Containers for customized boundary conditions ---*/
107 
108  CustomBoundaryHeatFlux = NULL; //Customized heat flux wall
109  CustomBoundaryTemperature = NULL; //Customized temperature wall
110 
111  /*--- MPI point-to-point data structures ---*/
112 
113  nP2PSend = 0;
114  nP2PRecv = 0;
115 
116  countPerPoint = 0;
117 
118  bufD_P2PSend = NULL;
119  bufD_P2PRecv = NULL;
120 
121  bufS_P2PSend = NULL;
122  bufS_P2PRecv = NULL;
123 
124  req_P2PSend = NULL;
125  req_P2PRecv = NULL;
126 
127  nPoint_P2PSend = NULL;
128  nPoint_P2PRecv = NULL;
129 
130  Neighbors_P2PSend = NULL;
131  Neighbors_P2PRecv = NULL;
132 
133  Local_Point_P2PSend = NULL;
134  Local_Point_P2PRecv = NULL;
135 
136  /*--- MPI periodic data structures ---*/
137 
138  nPeriodicSend = 0;
139  nPeriodicRecv = 0;
140 
141  countPerPeriodicPoint = 0;
142 
143  bufD_PeriodicSend = NULL;
144  bufD_PeriodicRecv = NULL;
145 
146  bufS_PeriodicSend = NULL;
147  bufS_PeriodicRecv = NULL;
148 
149  req_PeriodicSend = NULL;
150  req_PeriodicRecv = NULL;
151 
152  nPoint_PeriodicSend = NULL;
153  nPoint_PeriodicRecv = NULL;
154 
155  Neighbors_PeriodicSend = NULL;
156  Neighbors_PeriodicRecv = NULL;
157 
158  Local_Point_PeriodicSend = NULL;
159  Local_Point_PeriodicRecv = NULL;
160 
161  Local_Marker_PeriodicSend = NULL;
162  Local_Marker_PeriodicRecv = NULL;
163 
164 }
165 
166 CGeometry::~CGeometry(void) {
167 
168  unsigned long iElem, iElem_Bound, iEdge, iFace, iPoint, iVertex;
169  unsigned short iMarker;
170 
171  if (elem != NULL) {
172  for (iElem = 0; iElem < nElem; iElem++)
173  if (elem[iElem] != NULL) delete elem[iElem];
174  delete[] elem;
175  }
176 
177  if (bound != NULL) {
178  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++) {
179  for (iElem_Bound = 0; iElem_Bound < nElem_Bound[iMarker]; iElem_Bound++) {
180  if (bound[iMarker][iElem_Bound] != NULL) delete bound[iMarker][iElem_Bound];
181  }
182  if (bound[iMarker] != NULL) delete [] bound[iMarker];
183  }
184  delete [] bound;
185  }
186 
187  if (face != NULL) {
188  for (iFace = 0; iFace < nFace; iFace ++)
189  if (face[iFace] != NULL) delete face[iFace];
190  delete[] face;
191  }
192 
193  if (node != NULL) {
194  for (iPoint = 0; iPoint < nPointNode; iPoint ++)
195  if (node[iPoint] != NULL) delete node[iPoint];
196  delete[] node;
197  }
198 
199 
200  if (edge != NULL) {
201  for (iEdge = 0; iEdge < nEdge; iEdge ++)
202  if (edge[iEdge] != NULL) delete edge[iEdge];
203  delete[] edge;
204  }
205 
206  if (vertex != NULL) {
207  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++) {
208  for (iVertex = 0; iVertex < nVertex[iMarker]; iVertex++) {
209  if (vertex[iMarker][iVertex] != NULL) delete vertex[iMarker][iVertex];
210  }
211  if (vertex[iMarker] != NULL) delete [] vertex[iMarker];
212  }
213  delete [] vertex;
214  }
215 
216  if (newBound != NULL) {
217  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++) {
218  for (iElem_Bound = 0; iElem_Bound < nElem_Bound[iMarker]; iElem_Bound++) {
219  if (newBound[iMarker][iElem_Bound] != NULL) delete [] newBound[iMarker][iElem_Bound];
220  }
221  delete[] newBound[iMarker];
222  }
223  delete[] newBound;
224  }
225 
226  if (nElem_Bound != NULL) delete [] nElem_Bound;
227  if (nVertex != NULL) delete [] nVertex;
228  if (nNewElem_Bound != NULL) delete [] nNewElem_Bound;
229  if (Marker_All_SendRecv != NULL) delete [] Marker_All_SendRecv;
230  if (Tag_to_Marker != NULL) delete [] Tag_to_Marker;
231 
232  if (beg_node != NULL) delete [] beg_node;
233  if (end_node != NULL) delete [] end_node;
234  if (nPointLinear != NULL) delete [] nPointLinear;
235  if (nPointCumulative != NULL) delete [] nPointCumulative;
236 
237  if(CustomBoundaryHeatFlux != NULL){
238  for(iMarker=0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++){
239  if (CustomBoundaryHeatFlux[iMarker] != NULL) delete [] CustomBoundaryHeatFlux[iMarker];
240  }
241  delete [] CustomBoundaryHeatFlux;
242  }
243 
244  if(CustomBoundaryTemperature != NULL){
245  for(iMarker=0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++){
246  if(CustomBoundaryTemperature[iMarker] != NULL) delete [] CustomBoundaryTemperature[iMarker];
247  }
248  delete [] CustomBoundaryTemperature;
249  }
250 
251  /*--- Delete structures for MPI point-to-point communication. ---*/
252 
253  if (bufD_P2PRecv != NULL) delete [] bufD_P2PRecv;
254  if (bufD_P2PSend != NULL) delete [] bufD_P2PSend;
255 
256  if (bufS_P2PRecv != NULL) delete [] bufS_P2PRecv;
257  if (bufS_P2PSend != NULL) delete [] bufS_P2PSend;
258 
259  if (req_P2PSend != NULL) delete [] req_P2PSend;
260  if (req_P2PRecv != NULL) delete [] req_P2PRecv;
261 
262  if (nPoint_P2PRecv != NULL) delete [] nPoint_P2PRecv;
263  if (nPoint_P2PSend != NULL) delete [] nPoint_P2PSend;
264 
265  if (Neighbors_P2PSend != NULL) delete [] Neighbors_P2PSend;
266  if (Neighbors_P2PRecv != NULL) delete [] Neighbors_P2PRecv;
267 
268  if (Local_Point_P2PSend != NULL) delete [] Local_Point_P2PSend;
269  if (Local_Point_P2PRecv != NULL) delete [] Local_Point_P2PRecv;
270 
271  /*--- Delete structures for MPI periodic communication. ---*/
272 
273  if (bufD_PeriodicRecv != NULL) delete [] bufD_PeriodicRecv;
274  if (bufD_PeriodicSend != NULL) delete [] bufD_PeriodicSend;
275 
276  if (bufS_PeriodicRecv != NULL) delete [] bufS_PeriodicRecv;
277  if (bufS_PeriodicSend != NULL) delete [] bufS_PeriodicSend;
278 
279  if (req_PeriodicSend != NULL) delete [] req_PeriodicSend;
280  if (req_PeriodicRecv != NULL) delete [] req_PeriodicRecv;
281 
282  if (nPoint_PeriodicRecv != NULL) delete [] nPoint_PeriodicRecv;
283  if (nPoint_PeriodicSend != NULL) delete [] nPoint_PeriodicSend;
284 
285  if (Neighbors_PeriodicSend != NULL) delete [] Neighbors_PeriodicSend;
286  if (Neighbors_PeriodicRecv != NULL) delete [] Neighbors_PeriodicRecv;
287 
288  if (Local_Point_PeriodicSend != NULL) delete [] Local_Point_PeriodicSend;
289  if (Local_Point_PeriodicRecv != NULL) delete [] Local_Point_PeriodicRecv;
290 
291  if (Local_Marker_PeriodicSend != NULL) delete [] Local_Marker_PeriodicSend;
292  if (Local_Marker_PeriodicRecv != NULL) delete [] Local_Marker_PeriodicRecv;
293 
294 }
295 
296 void CGeometry::PreprocessP2PComms(CGeometry *geometry,
297  CConfig *config) {
298 
299  /*--- We start with the send and receive lists already available in
300  the form of SEND_RECEIVE boundary markers. We will loop through
301  these markers and establish the neighboring ranks and number of
302  send/recv points per pair. We will store this information and set
303  up persistent data structures so that we can reuse them throughout
304  the calculation for any point-to-point communications. The goal
305  is to break the non-blocking comms into InitiateComms() and
306  CompleteComms() in separate routines so that we can overlap the
307  communication and computation to hide the communication latency. ---*/
308 
309  /*--- Local variables. ---*/
310 
311  unsigned short iMarker;
312  unsigned long nVertexS, nVertexR, iVertex, MarkerS, MarkerR;
313 
314  int iRank, iSend, iRecv, count;
315 
316  /*--- Create some temporary structures for tracking sends/recvs. ---*/
317 
318  int *nPoint_Send_All = new int[size+1]; nPoint_Send_All[0] = 0;
319  int *nPoint_Recv_All = new int[size+1]; nPoint_Recv_All[0] = 0;
320  int *nPoint_Flag = new int[size];
321 
322  for (iRank = 0; iRank < size; iRank++) {
323  nPoint_Send_All[iRank] = 0; nPoint_Recv_All[iRank] = 0; nPoint_Flag[iRank]= -1;
324  }
325  nPoint_Send_All[size] = 0; nPoint_Recv_All[size] = 0;
326 
327  /*--- Loop through all of our SEND_RECEIVE markers and track
328  our sends with each rank. ---*/
329 
330  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < config->GetnMarker_All(); iMarker++) {
331  if ((config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker) == SEND_RECEIVE) &&
332  (config->GetMarker_All_SendRecv(iMarker) > 0)) {
333 
334  /*--- Get the destination rank and number of points to send. ---*/
335 
336  iRank = config->GetMarker_All_SendRecv(iMarker)-1;
337  nVertexS = geometry->nVertex[iMarker];
338 
339  /*--- If we have not visited this element yet, increment our
340  number of elements that must be sent to a particular proc. ---*/
341 
342  if ((nPoint_Flag[iRank] != (int)iMarker)) {
343  nPoint_Flag[iRank] = (int)iMarker;
344  nPoint_Send_All[iRank+1] += nVertexS;
345  }
346 
347  }
348  }
349 
350  delete [] nPoint_Flag;
351 
352  /*--- Communicate the number of points to be sent/recv'd amongst
353  all processors. After this communication, each proc knows how
354  many cells it will receive from each other processor. ---*/
355 
356  SU2_MPI::Alltoall(&(nPoint_Send_All[1]), 1, MPI_INT,
357  &(nPoint_Recv_All[1]), 1, MPI_INT, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
358 
359  /*--- Prepare to send connectivities. First check how many
360  messages we will be sending and receiving. Here we also put
361  the counters into cumulative storage format to make the
362  communications simpler. ---*/
363 
364  nP2PSend = 0; nP2PRecv = 0;
365 
366  for (iRank = 0; iRank < size; iRank++) {
367  if ((iRank != rank) && (nPoint_Send_All[iRank+1] > 0)) nP2PSend++;
368  if ((iRank != rank) && (nPoint_Recv_All[iRank+1] > 0)) nP2PRecv++;
369 
370  nPoint_Send_All[iRank+1] += nPoint_Send_All[iRank];
371  nPoint_Recv_All[iRank+1] += nPoint_Recv_All[iRank];
372  }
373 
374  /*--- Allocate only as much memory as we need for the P2P neighbors. ---*/
375 
376  nPoint_P2PSend = new int[nP2PSend+1]; nPoint_P2PSend[0] = 0;
377  nPoint_P2PRecv = new int[nP2PRecv+1]; nPoint_P2PRecv[0] = 0;
378 
379  Neighbors_P2PSend = new int[nP2PSend];
380  Neighbors_P2PRecv = new int[nP2PRecv];
381 
382  iSend = 0; iRecv = 0;
383  for (iRank = 0; iRank < size; iRank++) {
384 
385  if ((nPoint_Send_All[iRank+1] > nPoint_Send_All[iRank]) && (iRank != rank)) {
386  Neighbors_P2PSend[iSend] = iRank;
387  nPoint_P2PSend[iSend+1] = nPoint_Send_All[iRank+1];
388  iSend++;
389  }
390 
391  if ((nPoint_Recv_All[iRank+1] > nPoint_Recv_All[iRank]) && (iRank != rank)) {
392  Neighbors_P2PRecv[iRecv] = iRank;
393  nPoint_P2PRecv[iRecv+1] = nPoint_Recv_All[iRank+1];
394  iRecv++;
395  }
396 
397  }
398 
399  /*--- Create a reverse mapping of the message to the rank so that we
400  can quickly access the correct data in the buffers when receiving
401  messages dynamically. ---*/
402 
403  P2PSend2Neighbor.clear();
404  for (iSend = 0; iSend < nP2PSend; iSend++)
405  P2PSend2Neighbor[Neighbors_P2PSend[iSend]] = iSend;
406 
407  P2PRecv2Neighbor.clear();
408  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nP2PRecv; iRecv++)
409  P2PRecv2Neighbor[Neighbors_P2PRecv[iRecv]] = iRecv;
410 
411  delete [] nPoint_Send_All;
412  delete [] nPoint_Recv_All;
413 
414  /*--- Allocate the memory that we need for receiving the conn
415  values and then cue up the non-blocking receives. Note that
416  we do not include our own rank in the communications. We will
417  directly copy our own data later. ---*/
418 
419  Local_Point_P2PSend = NULL;
420  Local_Point_P2PSend = new unsigned long[nPoint_P2PSend[nP2PSend]];
421  for (iSend = 0; iSend < nPoint_P2PSend[nP2PSend]; iSend++)
422  Local_Point_P2PSend[iSend] = 0;
423 
424  Local_Point_P2PRecv = NULL;
425  Local_Point_P2PRecv = new unsigned long[nPoint_P2PRecv[nP2PRecv]];
426  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nPoint_P2PRecv[nP2PRecv]; iRecv++)
427  Local_Point_P2PRecv[iRecv] = 0;
428 
429  /*--- We allocate the memory for communicating values in a later step
430  once we know the maximum packet size that we need to communicate. This
431  memory is deallocated and reallocated automatically in the case that
432  the previously allocated memory is not sufficient. ---*/
433 
434  bufD_P2PSend = NULL;
435  bufD_P2PRecv = NULL;
436 
437  bufS_P2PSend = NULL;
438  bufS_P2PRecv = NULL;
439 
440  /*--- Allocate memory for the MPI requests if we need to communicate. ---*/
441 
442  if (nP2PSend > 0) {
443  req_P2PSend = new SU2_MPI::Request[nP2PSend];
444  }
445  if (nP2PRecv > 0) {
446  req_P2PRecv = new SU2_MPI::Request[nP2PRecv];
447  }
448 
449  /*--- Build lists of local index values for send. ---*/
450 
451  count = 0;
452  for (iSend = 0; iSend < nP2PSend; iSend++) {
453  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < config->GetnMarker_All(); iMarker++) {
454  if ((config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker) == SEND_RECEIVE) &&
455  (config->GetMarker_All_SendRecv(iMarker) > 0)) {
456 
457  MarkerS = iMarker;
458  nVertexS = geometry->nVertex[MarkerS];
459  iRank = config->GetMarker_All_SendRecv(MarkerS)-1;
460 
461  if (iRank == Neighbors_P2PSend[iSend]) {
462  for (iVertex = 0; iVertex < nVertexS; iVertex++) {
463  Local_Point_P2PSend[count] = geometry->vertex[MarkerS][iVertex]->GetNode();
464  count++;
465  }
466  }
467 
468  }
469  }
470  }
471 
472  /*--- Build lists of local index values for receive. ---*/
473 
474  count = 0;
475  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nP2PRecv; iRecv++) {
476  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < config->GetnMarker_All(); iMarker++) {
477  if ((config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker) == SEND_RECEIVE) &&
478  (config->GetMarker_All_SendRecv(iMarker) > 0)) {
479 
480  MarkerR = iMarker+1;
481  nVertexR = geometry->nVertex[MarkerR];
482  iRank = abs(config->GetMarker_All_SendRecv(MarkerR))-1;
483 
484  if (iRank == Neighbors_P2PRecv[iRecv]) {
485  for (iVertex = 0; iVertex < nVertexR; iVertex++) {
486  Local_Point_P2PRecv[count] = geometry->vertex[MarkerR][iVertex]->GetNode();
487  count++;
488  }
489  }
490 
491  }
492  }
493  }
494 
495  /*--- In the future, some additional data structures could be created
496  here to separate the interior and boundary nodes in order to help
497  further overlap computation and communication. ---*/
498 
499 }
500 
501 void CGeometry::AllocateP2PComms(unsigned short val_countPerPoint) {
502 
503  /*--- This routine is activated whenever we attempt to perform
504  a point-to-point MPI communication with our neighbors but the
505  memory buffer allocated is not large enough for the packet size.
506  Therefore, we deallocate the previously allocated space and
507  reallocate a large enough array. Note that after the first set
508  communications, this routine will not need to be called again. ---*/
509 
510  int iSend, iRecv;
511 
512  /*--- Store the larger packet size to the class data. ---*/
513 
514  countPerPoint = val_countPerPoint;
515 
516  /*-- Deallocate and reallocate our su2double cummunication memory. ---*/
517 
518  if (bufD_P2PSend != NULL) delete [] bufD_P2PSend;
519 
520  bufD_P2PSend = new su2double[countPerPoint*nPoint_P2PSend[nP2PSend]];
521  for (iSend = 0; iSend < countPerPoint*nPoint_P2PSend[nP2PSend]; iSend++)
522  bufD_P2PSend[iSend] = 0.0;
523 
524  if (bufD_P2PRecv != NULL) delete [] bufD_P2PRecv;
525 
526  bufD_P2PRecv = new su2double[countPerPoint*nPoint_P2PRecv[nP2PRecv]];
527  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < countPerPoint*nPoint_P2PRecv[nP2PRecv]; iRecv++)
528  bufD_P2PRecv[iRecv] = 0.0;
529 
530  if (bufS_P2PSend != NULL) delete [] bufS_P2PSend;
531 
532  bufS_P2PSend = new unsigned short[countPerPoint*nPoint_P2PSend[nP2PSend]];
533  for (iSend = 0; iSend < countPerPoint*nPoint_P2PSend[nP2PSend]; iSend++)
534  bufS_P2PSend[iSend] = 0;
535 
536  if (bufS_P2PRecv != NULL) delete [] bufS_P2PRecv;
537 
538  bufS_P2PRecv = new unsigned short[countPerPoint*nPoint_P2PRecv[nP2PRecv]];
539  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < countPerPoint*nPoint_P2PRecv[nP2PRecv]; iRecv++)
540  bufS_P2PRecv[iRecv] = 0;
541 
542 }
543 
544 void CGeometry::PostP2PRecvs(CGeometry *geometry,
545  CConfig *config,
546  unsigned short commType,
547  bool val_reverse) {
548 
549  /*--- Local variables ---*/
550 
551  int iMessage, iRecv, offset, nPointP2P, count, source, tag;
552 
553  /*--- Launch the non-blocking recv's first. Note that we have stored
554  the counts and sources, so we can launch these before we even load
555  the data and send from the neighbor ranks. ---*/
556 
557  iMessage = 0;
558  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nP2PRecv; iRecv++) {
559 
560  /*--- In some instances related to the adjoint solver, we need
561  to reverse the direction of communications such that the normal
562  send nodes become the recv nodes and vice-versa. ---*/
563 
564  if (val_reverse) {
565 
566  /*--- Compute our location in the buffer using the send data
567  structure since we are reversing the comms. ---*/
568 
569  offset = countPerPoint*nPoint_P2PSend[iRecv];
570 
571  /*--- Take advantage of cumulative storage format to get the number
572  of elems that we need to recv. Note again that we select the send
573  points here as the recv points. ---*/
574 
575  nPointP2P = nPoint_P2PSend[iRecv+1] - nPoint_P2PSend[iRecv];
576 
577  /*--- Total count can include multiple pieces of data per element. ---*/
578 
579  count = countPerPoint*nPointP2P;
580 
581  /*--- Get the rank from which we receive the message. Note again
582  that we use the send rank as the source instead of the recv rank. ---*/
583 
584  source = Neighbors_P2PSend[iRecv];
585  tag = source + 1;
586 
587  /*--- Post non-blocking recv for this proc. Note that we use the
588  send buffer here too. This is important to make sure the arrays
589  are the correct size. ---*/
590 
591  switch (commType) {
592  case COMM_TYPE_DOUBLE:
593  SU2_MPI::Irecv(&(bufD_P2PSend[offset]), count, MPI_DOUBLE,
594  source, tag, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &(req_P2PRecv[iMessage]));
595  break;
596  case COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_SHORT:
597  SU2_MPI::Irecv(&(bufS_P2PSend[offset]), count, MPI_UNSIGNED_SHORT,
598  source, tag, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &(req_P2PRecv[iMessage]));
599  break;
600  default:
601  SU2_MPI::Error("Unrecognized data type for point-to-point MPI comms.",
602  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
603  break;
604  }
605 
606  } else {
607 
608  /*--- Compute our location in the recv buffer. ---*/
609 
610  offset = countPerPoint*nPoint_P2PRecv[iRecv];
611 
612  /*--- Take advantage of cumulative storage format to get the number
613  of elems that we need to recv. ---*/
614 
615  nPointP2P = nPoint_P2PRecv[iRecv+1] - nPoint_P2PRecv[iRecv];
616 
617  /*--- Total count can include multiple pieces of data per element. ---*/
618 
619  count = countPerPoint*nPointP2P;
620 
621  /*--- Get the rank from which we receive the message. ---*/
622 
623  source = Neighbors_P2PRecv[iRecv];
624  tag = source + 1;
625 
626  /*--- Post non-blocking recv for this proc. ---*/
627 
628  switch (commType) {
629  case COMM_TYPE_DOUBLE:
630  SU2_MPI::Irecv(&(bufD_P2PRecv[offset]), count, MPI_DOUBLE,
631  source, tag, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &(req_P2PRecv[iMessage]));
632  break;
633  case COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_SHORT:
634  SU2_MPI::Irecv(&(bufS_P2PRecv[offset]), count, MPI_UNSIGNED_SHORT,
635  source, tag, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &(req_P2PRecv[iMessage]));
636  break;
637  default:
638  SU2_MPI::Error("Unrecognized data type for point-to-point MPI comms.",
639  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
640  break;
641  }
642 
643  }
644 
645  /*--- Increment message counter. ---*/
646 
647  iMessage++;
648 
649  }
650 
651 }
652 
653 void CGeometry::PostP2PSends(CGeometry *geometry,
654  CConfig *config,
655  unsigned short commType,
656  int val_iSend,
657  bool val_reverse) {
658 
659  /*--- Local variables ---*/
660 
661  int iMessage, offset, nPointP2P, count, dest, tag;
662 
663  /*--- Post the non-blocking send as soon as the buffer is loaded. ---*/
664 
665  iMessage = val_iSend;
666 
667  /*--- In some instances related to the adjoint solver, we need
668  to reverse the direction of communications such that the normal
669  send nodes become the recv nodes and vice-versa. ---*/
670 
671  if (val_reverse) {
672 
673  /*--- Compute our location in the buffer using the recv data
674  structure since we are reversing the comms. ---*/
675 
676  offset = countPerPoint*nPoint_P2PRecv[val_iSend];
677 
678  /*--- Take advantage of cumulative storage format to get the number
679  of points that we need to send. Note again that we select the recv
680  points here as the send points. ---*/
681 
682  nPointP2P = nPoint_P2PRecv[val_iSend+1] - nPoint_P2PRecv[val_iSend];
683 
684  /*--- Total count can include multiple pieces of data per element. ---*/
685 
686  count = countPerPoint*nPointP2P;
687 
688  /*--- Get the rank to which we send the message. Note again
689  that we use the recv rank as the dest instead of the send rank. ---*/
690 
691  dest = Neighbors_P2PRecv[val_iSend];
692  tag = rank + 1;
693 
694  /*--- Post non-blocking send for this proc. Note that we use the
695  send buffer here too. This is important to make sure the arrays
696  are the correct size. ---*/
697 
698  switch (commType) {
699  case COMM_TYPE_DOUBLE:
700  SU2_MPI::Isend(&(bufD_P2PRecv[offset]), count, MPI_DOUBLE,
701  dest, tag, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &(req_P2PSend[iMessage]));
702  break;
703  case COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_SHORT:
704  SU2_MPI::Isend(&(bufS_P2PRecv[offset]), count, MPI_UNSIGNED_SHORT,
705  dest, tag, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &(req_P2PSend[iMessage]));
706  break;
707  default:
708  SU2_MPI::Error("Unrecognized data type for point-to-point MPI comms.",
709  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
710  break;
711  }
712 
713  } else {
714 
715  /*--- Compute our location in the send buffer. ---*/
716 
717  offset = countPerPoint*nPoint_P2PSend[val_iSend];
718 
719  /*--- Take advantage of cumulative storage format to get the number
720  of points that we need to send. ---*/
721 
722  nPointP2P = nPoint_P2PSend[val_iSend+1] - nPoint_P2PSend[val_iSend];
723 
724  /*--- Total count can include multiple pieces of data per element. ---*/
725 
726  count = countPerPoint*nPointP2P;
727 
728  /*--- Get the rank to which we send the message. ---*/
729 
730  dest = Neighbors_P2PSend[val_iSend];
731  tag = rank + 1;
732 
733  /*--- Post non-blocking send for this proc. ---*/
734 
735  switch (commType) {
736  case COMM_TYPE_DOUBLE:
737  SU2_MPI::Isend(&(bufD_P2PSend[offset]), count, MPI_DOUBLE,
738  dest, tag, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &(req_P2PSend[iMessage]));
739  break;
740  case COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_SHORT:
741  SU2_MPI::Isend(&(bufS_P2PSend[offset]), count, MPI_UNSIGNED_SHORT,
742  dest, tag, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &(req_P2PSend[iMessage]));
743  break;
744  default:
745  SU2_MPI::Error("Unrecognized data type for point-to-point MPI comms.",
746  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
747  break;
748  }
749 
750  }
751 
752 }
753 
754 void CGeometry::InitiateComms(CGeometry *geometry,
755  CConfig *config,
756  unsigned short commType) {
757 
758  /*--- Local variables ---*/
759 
760  unsigned short iDim;
761  unsigned short COUNT_PER_POINT = 0;
762  unsigned short MPI_TYPE = 0;
763 
764  unsigned long iPoint, msg_offset, buf_offset;
765 
766  int iMessage, iSend, nSend;
767 
768  /*--- Set the size of the data packet and type depending on quantity. ---*/
769 
770  switch (commType) {
771  case COORDINATES:
772  COUNT_PER_POINT = nDim;
773  MPI_TYPE = COMM_TYPE_DOUBLE;
774  break;
775  case GRID_VELOCITY:
776  COUNT_PER_POINT = nDim;
777  MPI_TYPE = COMM_TYPE_DOUBLE;
778  break;
779  case COORDINATES_OLD:
780  if (config->GetTime_Marching() == DT_STEPPING_2ND)
781  COUNT_PER_POINT = nDim*2;
782  else
783  COUNT_PER_POINT = nDim;
784  MPI_TYPE = COMM_TYPE_DOUBLE;
785  break;
786  case MAX_LENGTH:
787  COUNT_PER_POINT = 1;
788  MPI_TYPE = COMM_TYPE_DOUBLE;
789  break;
790  case NEIGHBORS:
791  COUNT_PER_POINT = 1;
792  MPI_TYPE = COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_SHORT;
793  break;
794  default:
795  SU2_MPI::Error("Unrecognized quantity for point-to-point MPI comms.",
796  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
797  break;
798  }
799 
800  /*--- Check to make sure we have created a large enough buffer
801  for these comms during preprocessing. This is only for the su2double
802  buffer. It will be reallocated whenever we find a larger count
803  per point. After the first cycle of comms, this should be inactive. ---*/
804 
805  if (COUNT_PER_POINT > geometry->countPerPoint) {
806  geometry->AllocateP2PComms(COUNT_PER_POINT);
807  }
808 
809  /*--- Set some local pointers to make access simpler. ---*/
810 
811  su2double *bufDSend = geometry->bufD_P2PSend;
812  unsigned short *bufSSend = geometry->bufS_P2PSend;
813 
814  su2double *vector = NULL;
815 
816  /*--- Load the specified quantity from the solver into the generic
817  communication buffer in the geometry class. ---*/
818 
819  if (nP2PSend > 0) {
820 
821  /*--- Post all non-blocking recvs first before sends. ---*/
822 
823  geometry->PostP2PRecvs(geometry, config, MPI_TYPE, false);
824 
825  for (iMessage = 0; iMessage < nP2PSend; iMessage++) {
826 
827  /*--- Get the offset in the buffer for the start of this message. ---*/
828 
829  msg_offset = nPoint_P2PSend[iMessage];
830 
831  /*--- Total count can include multiple pieces of data per element. ---*/
832 
833  nSend = (nPoint_P2PSend[iMessage+1] - nPoint_P2PSend[iMessage]);
834 
835  for (iSend = 0; iSend < nSend; iSend++) {
836 
837  /*--- Get the local index for this communicated data. ---*/
838 
839  iPoint = geometry->Local_Point_P2PSend[msg_offset + iSend];
840 
841  /*--- Compute the offset in the recv buffer for this point. ---*/
842 
843  buf_offset = (msg_offset + iSend)*countPerPoint;
844 
845  switch (commType) {
846  case COORDINATES:
847  vector = node[iPoint]->GetCoord();
848  for (iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; iDim++)
849  bufDSend[buf_offset+iDim] = vector[iDim];
850  break;
851  case GRID_VELOCITY:
852  vector = node[iPoint]->GetGridVel();
853  for (iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; iDim++)
854  bufDSend[buf_offset+iDim] = vector[iDim];
855  break;
856  case COORDINATES_OLD:
857  vector = node[iPoint]->GetCoord_n();
858  for (iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; iDim++) {
859  bufDSend[buf_offset+iDim] = vector[iDim];
860  }
861  if (config->GetTime_Marching() == DT_STEPPING_2ND) {
862  vector = node[iPoint]->GetCoord_n1();
863  for (iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; iDim++) {
864  bufDSend[buf_offset+nDim+iDim] = vector[iDim];
865  }
866  }
867  break;
868  case MAX_LENGTH:
869  bufDSend[buf_offset] = node[iPoint]->GetMaxLength();
870  break;
871  case NEIGHBORS:
872  bufSSend[buf_offset] = geometry->node[iPoint]->GetnNeighbor();
873  break;
874  default:
875  SU2_MPI::Error("Unrecognized quantity for point-to-point MPI comms.",
876  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
877  break;
878  }
879  }
880 
881  /*--- Launch the point-to-point MPI send for this message. ---*/
882 
883  geometry->PostP2PSends(geometry, config, MPI_TYPE, iMessage, false);
884 
885  }
886  }
887 
888 }
889 
890 void CGeometry::CompleteComms(CGeometry *geometry,
891  CConfig *config,
892  unsigned short commType) {
893 
894  /*--- Local variables ---*/
895 
896  unsigned short iDim;
897  unsigned long iPoint, iRecv, nRecv, msg_offset, buf_offset;
898 
899  int ind, source, iMessage, jRecv;
900  SU2_MPI::Status status;
901 
902  /*--- Set some local pointers to make access simpler. ---*/
903 
904  su2double *bufDRecv = geometry->bufD_P2PRecv;
905  unsigned short *bufSRecv = geometry->bufS_P2PRecv;
906 
907  /*--- Store the data that was communicated into the appropriate
908  location within the local class data structures. Note that we
909  recv and store the data in any order to take advantage of the
910  non-blocking comms. ---*/
911 
912  if (nP2PRecv > 0) {
913 
914  for (iMessage = 0; iMessage < nP2PRecv; iMessage++) {
915 
916  /*--- For efficiency, recv the messages dynamically based on
917  the order they arrive. ---*/
918 
919  SU2_MPI::Waitany(nP2PRecv, req_P2PRecv, &ind, &status);
920 
921  /*--- Once we have recv'd a message, get the source rank. ---*/
922 
923  source = status.MPI_SOURCE;
924 
925  /*--- We know the offsets based on the source rank. ---*/
926 
927  jRecv = P2PRecv2Neighbor[source];
928 
929  /*--- Get the offset in the buffer for the start of this message. ---*/
930 
931  msg_offset = nPoint_P2PRecv[jRecv];
932 
933  /*--- Get the number of packets to be received in this message. ---*/
934 
935  nRecv = nPoint_P2PRecv[jRecv+1] - nPoint_P2PRecv[jRecv];
936 
937  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nRecv; iRecv++) {
938 
939  /*--- Get the local index for this communicated data. ---*/
940 
941  iPoint = geometry->Local_Point_P2PRecv[msg_offset + iRecv];
942 
943  /*--- Compute the total offset in the recv buffer for this point. ---*/
944 
945  buf_offset = (msg_offset + iRecv)*countPerPoint;
946 
947  /*--- Store the data correctly depending on the quantity. ---*/
948 
949  switch (commType) {
950  case COORDINATES:
951  for (iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; iDim++)
952  node[iPoint]->SetCoord(iDim, bufDRecv[buf_offset+iDim]);
953  break;
954  case GRID_VELOCITY:
955  for (iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; iDim++)
956  node[iPoint]->SetGridVel(iDim, bufDRecv[buf_offset+iDim]);
957  break;
958  case COORDINATES_OLD:
959  node[iPoint]->SetCoord_n(&bufDRecv[buf_offset]);
960  if (config->GetTime_Marching() == DT_STEPPING_2ND)
961  node[iPoint]->SetCoord_n1(&bufDRecv[buf_offset+nDim]);
962  break;
963  case MAX_LENGTH:
964  node[iPoint]->SetMaxLength(bufDRecv[buf_offset]);
965  break;
966  case NEIGHBORS:
967  node[iPoint]->SetnNeighbor(bufSRecv[buf_offset]);
968  break;
969  default:
970  SU2_MPI::Error("Unrecognized quantity for point-to-point MPI comms.",
971  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
972  break;
973  }
974  }
975  }
976 
977  /*--- Verify that all non-blocking point-to-point sends have finished.
978  Note that this should be satisfied, as we have received all of the
979  data in the loop above at this point. ---*/
980 
981 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
982  SU2_MPI::Waitall(nP2PSend, req_P2PSend, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
983 #endif
984 
985  }
986 
987 }
988 
989 void CGeometry::PreprocessPeriodicComms(CGeometry *geometry,
990  CConfig *config) {
991 
992  /*--- We start with the send and receive lists already available in
993  the form of stored periodic point-donor pairs. We will loop through
994  these markers and establish the neighboring ranks and number of
995  send/recv points per pair. We will store this information and set
996  up persistent data structures so that we can reuse them throughout
997  the calculation for any periodic boundary communications. The goal
998  is to break the non-blocking comms into InitiatePeriodicComms() and
999  CompletePeriodicComms() in separate routines so that we can overlap the
1000  communication and computation to hide the communication latency. ---*/
1001 
1002  /*--- Local variables. ---*/
1003 
1004  unsigned short iMarker;
1005  unsigned long iPoint, iVertex, iPeriodic;
1006 
1007  int iRank, iSend, iRecv, ii, jj;
1008 
1009  /*--- Create some temporary structures for tracking sends/recvs. ---*/
1010 
1011  int *nPoint_Send_All = new int[size+1]; nPoint_Send_All[0] = 0;
1012  int *nPoint_Recv_All = new int[size+1]; nPoint_Recv_All[0] = 0;
1013  int *nPoint_Flag = new int[size];
1014 
1015  for (iRank = 0; iRank < size; iRank++) {
1016  nPoint_Send_All[iRank] = 0;
1017  nPoint_Recv_All[iRank] = 0;
1018  nPoint_Flag[iRank]= -1;
1019  }
1020  nPoint_Send_All[size] = 0; nPoint_Recv_All[size] = 0;
1021 
1022  /*--- Loop through all of our periodic markers and track
1023  our sends with each rank. ---*/
1024 
1025  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < config->GetnMarker_All(); iMarker++) {
1026  if (config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker) == PERIODIC_BOUNDARY) {
1027  iPeriodic = config->GetMarker_All_PerBound(iMarker);
1028  for (iVertex = 0; iVertex < geometry->nVertex[iMarker]; iVertex++) {
1029 
1030  /*--- Get the current periodic point index. We only communicate
1031  the owned nodes on a rank, as the MPI comms will take care of
1032  the halos after completing the periodic comms. ---*/
1033 
1034  iPoint = geometry->vertex[iMarker][iVertex]->GetNode();
1035 
1036  if (geometry->node[iPoint]->GetDomain()) {
1037 
1038  /*--- Get the rank that holds the matching periodic point
1039  on the other marker in the periodic pair. ---*/
1040 
1041  iRank = (int)geometry->vertex[iMarker][iVertex]->GetDonorProcessor();
1042 
1043  /*--- If we have not visited this point last, increment our
1044  number of points that must be sent to a particular proc. ---*/
1045 
1046  if ((nPoint_Flag[iRank] != (int)iPoint)) {
1047  nPoint_Flag[iRank] = (int)iPoint;
1048  nPoint_Send_All[iRank+1] += 1;
1049  }
1050 
1051  }
1052  }
1053  }
1054  }
1055 
1056  delete [] nPoint_Flag;
1057 
1058  /*--- Communicate the number of points to be sent/recv'd amongst
1059  all processors. After this communication, each proc knows how
1060  many periodic points it will receive from each other processor. ---*/
1061 
1062  SU2_MPI::Alltoall(&(nPoint_Send_All[1]), 1, MPI_INT,
1063  &(nPoint_Recv_All[1]), 1, MPI_INT, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
1064 
1065  /*--- Check how many messages we will be sending and receiving.
1066  Here we also put the counters into cumulative storage format to
1067  make the communications simpler. Note that we are allowing each
1068  rank to communicate to themselves in these counters, although
1069  it will not be done through MPI. ---*/
1070 
1071  nPeriodicSend = 0; nPeriodicRecv = 0;
1072 
1073  for (iRank = 0; iRank < size; iRank++) {
1074  if ((nPoint_Send_All[iRank+1] > 0)) nPeriodicSend++;
1075  if ((nPoint_Recv_All[iRank+1] > 0)) nPeriodicRecv++;
1076 
1077  nPoint_Send_All[iRank+1] += nPoint_Send_All[iRank];
1078  nPoint_Recv_All[iRank+1] += nPoint_Recv_All[iRank];
1079  }
1080 
1081  /*--- Allocate only as much memory as needed for the periodic neighbors. ---*/
1082 
1083  nPoint_PeriodicSend = new int[nPeriodicSend+1]; nPoint_PeriodicSend[0] = 0;
1084  nPoint_PeriodicRecv = new int[nPeriodicRecv+1]; nPoint_PeriodicRecv[0] = 0;
1085 
1086  Neighbors_PeriodicSend = new int[nPeriodicSend];
1087  Neighbors_PeriodicRecv = new int[nPeriodicRecv];
1088 
1089  iSend = 0; iRecv = 0;
1090  for (iRank = 0; iRank < size; iRank++) {
1091  if ((nPoint_Send_All[iRank+1] > nPoint_Send_All[iRank])) {
1092  Neighbors_PeriodicSend[iSend] = iRank;
1093  nPoint_PeriodicSend[iSend+1] = nPoint_Send_All[iRank+1];
1094  iSend++;
1095  }
1096  if ((nPoint_Recv_All[iRank+1] > nPoint_Recv_All[iRank])) {
1097  Neighbors_PeriodicRecv[iRecv] = iRank;
1098  nPoint_PeriodicRecv[iRecv+1] = nPoint_Recv_All[iRank+1];
1099  iRecv++;
1100  }
1101  }
1102 
1103  /*--- Create a reverse mapping of the message to the rank so that we
1104  can quickly access the correct data in the buffers when receiving
1105  messages dynamically later during the iterations. ---*/
1106 
1107  PeriodicSend2Neighbor.clear();
1108  for (iSend = 0; iSend < nPeriodicSend; iSend++)
1109  PeriodicSend2Neighbor[Neighbors_PeriodicSend[iSend]] = iSend;
1110 
1111  PeriodicRecv2Neighbor.clear();
1112  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nPeriodicRecv; iRecv++)
1113  PeriodicRecv2Neighbor[Neighbors_PeriodicRecv[iRecv]] = iRecv;
1114 
1115  delete [] nPoint_Send_All;
1116  delete [] nPoint_Recv_All;
1117 
1118  /*--- Allocate the memory to store the local index values for both
1119  the send and receive periodic points and periodic index. ---*/
1120 
1121  Local_Point_PeriodicSend = NULL;
1122  Local_Point_PeriodicSend = new unsigned long[nPoint_PeriodicSend[nPeriodicSend]];
1123  for (iSend = 0; iSend < nPoint_PeriodicSend[nPeriodicSend]; iSend++)
1124  Local_Point_PeriodicSend[iSend] = 0;
1125 
1126  Local_Marker_PeriodicSend = NULL;
1127  Local_Marker_PeriodicSend = new unsigned long[nPoint_PeriodicSend[nPeriodicSend]];
1128  for (iSend = 0; iSend < nPoint_PeriodicSend[nPeriodicSend]; iSend++)
1129  Local_Marker_PeriodicSend[iSend] = 0;
1130 
1131  Local_Point_PeriodicRecv = NULL;
1132  Local_Point_PeriodicRecv = new unsigned long[nPoint_PeriodicRecv[nPeriodicRecv]];
1133  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nPoint_PeriodicRecv[nPeriodicRecv]; iRecv++)
1134  Local_Point_PeriodicRecv[iRecv] = 0;
1135 
1136  Local_Marker_PeriodicRecv = NULL;
1137  Local_Marker_PeriodicRecv = new unsigned long[nPoint_PeriodicRecv[nPeriodicRecv]];
1138  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nPoint_PeriodicRecv[nPeriodicRecv]; iRecv++)
1139  Local_Marker_PeriodicRecv[iRecv] = 0;
1140 
1141  /*--- We allocate the buffers for communicating values in a later step
1142  once we know the maximum packet size that we need to communicate. This
1143  memory is deallocated and reallocated automatically in the case that
1144  the previously allocated memory is not sufficient. ---*/
1145 
1146  bufD_PeriodicSend = NULL;
1147  bufD_PeriodicRecv = NULL;
1148 
1149  bufS_PeriodicSend = NULL;
1150  bufS_PeriodicRecv = NULL;
1151 
1152  /*--- Allocate memory for the MPI requests if we need to communicate. ---*/
1153 
1154  if (nPeriodicSend > 0) {
1155  req_PeriodicSend = new SU2_MPI::Request[nPeriodicSend];
1156  }
1157  if (nPeriodicRecv > 0) {
1158  req_PeriodicRecv = new SU2_MPI::Request[nPeriodicRecv];
1159  }
1160 
1161  /*--- Allocate arrays for sending the periodic point index and marker
1162  index to the recv rank so that it can store the local values. Therefore,
1163  the recv rank can quickly loop through the buffers to unpack the data. ---*/
1164 
1165  unsigned short nPackets = 2;
1166  unsigned long *idSend = new unsigned long[nPoint_PeriodicSend[nPeriodicSend]*nPackets];
1167  for (iSend = 0; iSend < nPoint_PeriodicSend[nPeriodicSend]*nPackets; iSend++)
1168  idSend[iSend] = 0;
1169 
1170  /*--- Build the lists of local index and periodic marker index values. ---*/
1171 
1172  ii = 0; jj = 0;
1173  for (iSend = 0; iSend < nPeriodicSend; iSend++) {
1174  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < config->GetnMarker_All(); iMarker++) {
1175  if (config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker) == PERIODIC_BOUNDARY) {
1176  iPeriodic = config->GetMarker_All_PerBound(iMarker);
1177  for (iVertex = 0; iVertex < geometry->nVertex[iMarker]; iVertex++) {
1178 
1179  /*--- Get the current periodic point index. We only communicate
1180  the owned nodes on a rank, as the MPI comms will take care of
1181  the halos after completing the periodic comms. ---*/
1182 
1183  iPoint = geometry->vertex[iMarker][iVertex]->GetNode();
1184 
1185  if (geometry->node[iPoint]->GetDomain()) {
1186 
1187  /*--- Get the rank that holds the matching periodic point
1188  on the other marker in the periodic pair. ---*/
1189 
1190  iRank = (int)geometry->vertex[iMarker][iVertex]->GetDonorProcessor();
1191 
1192  /*--- If the rank for the current periodic point matches the
1193  rank of the current send message, then store the local point
1194  index on the matching periodic point and the periodic marker
1195  index to be communicated to the recv rank. ---*/
1196 
1197  if (iRank == Neighbors_PeriodicSend[iSend]) {
1198  Local_Point_PeriodicSend[ii] = iPoint;
1199  Local_Marker_PeriodicSend[ii] = (unsigned long)iMarker;
1200  jj = ii*nPackets;
1201  idSend[jj] = geometry->vertex[iMarker][iVertex]->GetDonorPoint();
1202  jj++;
1203  idSend[jj] = (unsigned long)iPeriodic;
1204  ii++;
1205  }
1206 
1207  }
1208  }
1209  }
1210  }
1211  }
1212 
1213  /*--- Allocate arrays for receiving the periodic point index and marker
1214  index to the recv rank so that it can store the local values. ---*/
1215 
1216  unsigned long *idRecv = new unsigned long[nPoint_PeriodicRecv[nPeriodicRecv]*nPackets];
1217  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nPoint_PeriodicRecv[nPeriodicRecv]*nPackets; iRecv++)
1218  idRecv[iRecv] = 0;
1219 
1220 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
1221 
1222  int iMessage, offset, count, source, dest, tag;
1223 
1224  /*--- Launch the non-blocking recv's first. Note that we have stored
1225  the counts and sources, so we can launch these before we even load
1226  the data and send from the periodically matching ranks. ---*/
1227 
1228  iMessage = 0;
1229  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nPeriodicRecv; iRecv++) {
1230 
1231  /*--- Compute our location in the recv buffer. ---*/
1232 
1233  offset = nPackets*nPoint_PeriodicRecv[iRecv];
1234 
1235  /*--- Take advantage of cumulative storage format to get the number
1236  of elems that we need to recv. ---*/
1237 
1238  count = nPackets*(nPoint_PeriodicRecv[iRecv+1] - nPoint_PeriodicRecv[iRecv]);
1239 
1240  /*--- Get the rank from which we receive the message. ---*/
1241 
1242  source = Neighbors_PeriodicRecv[iRecv];
1243  tag = source + 1;
1244 
1245  /*--- Post non-blocking recv for this proc. ---*/
1246 
1247  SU2_MPI::Irecv(&(static_cast<unsigned long*>(idRecv)[offset]),
1248  count, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, source, tag, MPI_COMM_WORLD,
1249  &(req_PeriodicRecv[iMessage]));
1250 
1251  /*--- Increment message counter. ---*/
1252 
1253  iMessage++;
1254 
1255  }
1256 
1257  /*--- Post the non-blocking sends. ---*/
1258 
1259  iMessage = 0;
1260  for (iSend = 0; iSend < nPeriodicSend; iSend++) {
1261 
1262  /*--- Compute our location in the send buffer. ---*/
1263 
1264  offset = nPackets*nPoint_PeriodicSend[iSend];
1265 
1266  /*--- Take advantage of cumulative storage format to get the number
1267  of points that we need to send. ---*/
1268 
1269  count = nPackets*(nPoint_PeriodicSend[iSend+1] - nPoint_PeriodicSend[iSend]);
1270 
1271  /*--- Get the rank to which we send the message. ---*/
1272 
1273  dest = Neighbors_PeriodicSend[iSend];
1274  tag = rank + 1;
1275 
1276  /*--- Post non-blocking send for this proc. ---*/
1277 
1278  SU2_MPI::Isend(&(static_cast<unsigned long*>(idSend)[offset]),
1279  count, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, dest, tag, MPI_COMM_WORLD,
1280  &(req_PeriodicSend[iMessage]));
1281 
1282  /*--- Increment message counter. ---*/
1283 
1284  iMessage++;
1285 
1286  }
1287 
1288  /*--- Wait for the non-blocking comms to complete. ---*/
1289 
1290  SU2_MPI::Waitall(nPeriodicSend, req_PeriodicSend, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
1291  SU2_MPI::Waitall(nPeriodicRecv, req_PeriodicRecv, MPI_STATUS_IGNORE);
1292 
1293 #else
1294 
1295  /*--- Copy my own rank's data into the recv buffer directly in serial. ---*/
1296 
1297  int myStart, myFinal;
1298  for (int val_iSend = 0; val_iSend < nPeriodicSend; val_iSend++) {
1299  iRank = geometry->PeriodicRecv2Neighbor[rank];
1300  iRecv = geometry->nPoint_PeriodicRecv[iRank]*nPackets;
1301  myStart = nPoint_PeriodicSend[val_iSend]*nPackets;
1302  myFinal = nPoint_PeriodicSend[val_iSend+1]*nPackets;
1303  for (iSend = myStart; iSend < myFinal; iSend++) {
1304  idRecv[iRecv] = idSend[iSend];
1305  iRecv++;
1306  }
1307  }
1308 
1309 #endif
1310 
1311  /*--- Store the local periodic point and marker index values in our
1312  data structures so we can quickly unpack data during the iterations. ---*/
1313 
1314  ii = 0;
1315  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nPoint_PeriodicRecv[nPeriodicRecv]; iRecv++) {
1316  Local_Point_PeriodicRecv[iRecv] = idRecv[ii]; ii++;
1317  Local_Marker_PeriodicRecv[iRecv] = idRecv[ii]; ii++;
1318  }
1319 
1320  delete [] idSend;
1321  delete [] idRecv;
1322 
1323 }
1324 
1325 void CGeometry::AllocatePeriodicComms(unsigned short val_countPerPeriodicPoint) {
1326 
1327  /*--- This routine is activated whenever we attempt to perform
1328  a periodic MPI communication with our neighbors but the
1329  memory buffer allocated is not large enough for the packet size.
1330  Therefore, we deallocate the previously allocated arrays and
1331  reallocate a large enough array. Note that after the first set
1332  communications, this routine will not need to be called again. ---*/
1333 
1334  int iSend, iRecv, nSend, nRecv;
1335 
1336  /*--- Store the larger packet size to the class data. ---*/
1337 
1338  countPerPeriodicPoint = val_countPerPeriodicPoint;
1339 
1340  /*--- Store the total size of the send/recv arrays for clarity. ---*/
1341 
1342  nSend = countPerPeriodicPoint*nPoint_PeriodicSend[nPeriodicSend];
1343  nRecv = countPerPeriodicPoint*nPoint_PeriodicRecv[nPeriodicRecv];
1344 
1345  /*-- Deallocate and reallocate our cummunication memory. ---*/
1346 
1347  if (bufD_PeriodicSend != NULL) delete [] bufD_PeriodicSend;
1348 
1349  bufD_PeriodicSend = new su2double[nSend];
1350  for (iSend = 0; iSend < nSend; iSend++)
1351  bufD_PeriodicSend[iSend] = 0.0;
1352 
1353  if (bufD_PeriodicRecv != NULL) delete [] bufD_PeriodicRecv;
1354 
1355  bufD_PeriodicRecv = new su2double[nRecv];
1356  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nRecv; iRecv++)
1357  bufD_PeriodicRecv[iRecv] = 0.0;
1358 
1359  if (bufS_PeriodicSend != NULL) delete [] bufS_PeriodicSend;
1360 
1361  bufS_PeriodicSend = new unsigned short[nSend];
1362  for (iSend = 0; iSend < nSend; iSend++)
1363  bufS_PeriodicSend[iSend] = 0;
1364 
1365  if (bufS_PeriodicRecv != NULL) delete [] bufS_PeriodicRecv;
1366 
1367  bufS_PeriodicRecv = new unsigned short[nRecv];
1368  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nRecv; iRecv++)
1369  bufS_PeriodicRecv[iRecv] = 0;
1370 
1371 }
1372 
1373 void CGeometry::PostPeriodicRecvs(CGeometry *geometry,
1374  CConfig *config,
1375  unsigned short commType) {
1376 
1377  /*--- In parallel, communicate the data with non-blocking send/recv. ---*/
1378 
1379 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
1380 
1381  /*--- Local variables ---*/
1382 
1383  int iMessage, iRecv, offset, nPointPeriodic, count, source, tag;
1384 
1385  /*--- Launch the non-blocking recv's first. Note that we have stored
1386  the counts and sources, so we can launch these before we even load
1387  the data and send from the neighbor ranks. ---*/
1388 
1389  iMessage = 0;
1390  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nPeriodicRecv; iRecv++) {
1391 
1392  /*--- Compute our location in the recv buffer. ---*/
1393 
1394  offset = countPerPeriodicPoint*nPoint_PeriodicRecv[iRecv];
1395 
1396  /*--- Take advantage of cumulative storage format to get the number
1397  of elems that we need to recv. ---*/
1398 
1399  nPointPeriodic = nPoint_PeriodicRecv[iRecv+1] - nPoint_PeriodicRecv[iRecv];
1400 
1401  /*--- Total count can include multiple pieces of data per element. ---*/
1402 
1403  count = countPerPeriodicPoint*nPointPeriodic;
1404 
1405  /*--- Get the rank from which we receive the message. ---*/
1406 
1407  source = Neighbors_PeriodicRecv[iRecv];
1408  tag = source + 1;
1409 
1410  /*--- Post non-blocking recv for this proc. ---*/
1411 
1412  switch (commType) {
1413  case COMM_TYPE_DOUBLE:
1414  SU2_MPI::Irecv(&(static_cast<su2double*>(bufD_PeriodicRecv)[offset]),
1415  count, MPI_DOUBLE, source, tag, MPI_COMM_WORLD,
1416  &(req_PeriodicRecv[iMessage]));
1417  break;
1418  case COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_SHORT:
1419  SU2_MPI::Irecv(&(static_cast<unsigned short*>(bufS_PeriodicRecv)[offset]),
1420  count, MPI_UNSIGNED_SHORT, source, tag, MPI_COMM_WORLD,
1421  &(req_PeriodicRecv[iMessage]));
1422  break;
1423  default:
1424  SU2_MPI::Error("Unrecognized data type for periodic MPI comms.",
1425  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1426  break;
1427  }
1428 
1429  /*--- Increment message counter. ---*/
1430 
1431  iMessage++;
1432 
1433  }
1434 
1435 #endif
1436 
1437 }
1438 
1439 void CGeometry::PostPeriodicSends(CGeometry *geometry,
1440  CConfig *config,
1441  unsigned short commType,
1442  int val_iSend) {
1443 
1444  /*--- In parallel, communicate the data with non-blocking send/recv. ---*/
1445 
1446 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
1447 
1448  /*--- Local variables ---*/
1449 
1450  int iMessage, offset, nPointPeriodic, count, dest, tag;
1451 
1452  /*--- Post the non-blocking send as soon as the buffer is loaded. ---*/
1453 
1454  iMessage = val_iSend;
1455 
1456  /*--- Compute our location in the send buffer. ---*/
1457 
1458  offset = countPerPeriodicPoint*nPoint_PeriodicSend[val_iSend];
1459 
1460  /*--- Take advantage of cumulative storage format to get the number
1461  of points that we need to send. ---*/
1462 
1463  nPointPeriodic = (nPoint_PeriodicSend[val_iSend+1] -
1464  nPoint_PeriodicSend[val_iSend]);
1465 
1466  /*--- Total count can include multiple pieces of data per element. ---*/
1467 
1468  count = countPerPeriodicPoint*nPointPeriodic;
1469 
1470  /*--- Get the rank to which we send the message. ---*/
1471 
1472  dest = Neighbors_PeriodicSend[val_iSend];
1473  tag = rank + 1;
1474 
1475  /*--- Post non-blocking send for this proc. ---*/
1476 
1477  switch (commType) {
1478  case COMM_TYPE_DOUBLE:
1479  SU2_MPI::Isend(&(static_cast<su2double*>(bufD_PeriodicSend)[offset]),
1480  count, MPI_DOUBLE, dest, tag, MPI_COMM_WORLD,
1481  &(req_PeriodicSend[iMessage]));
1482  break;
1483  case COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_SHORT:
1484  SU2_MPI::Isend(&(static_cast<unsigned short*>(bufS_PeriodicSend)[offset]),
1485  count, MPI_UNSIGNED_SHORT, dest, tag, MPI_COMM_WORLD,
1486  &(req_PeriodicSend[iMessage]));
1487  break;
1488  default:
1489  SU2_MPI::Error("Unrecognized data type for periodic MPI comms.",
1490  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1491  break;
1492  }
1493 
1494 #else
1495 
1496  /*--- Copy my own rank's data into the recv buffer directly in serial. ---*/
1497 
1498  int iSend, myStart, myFinal, iRecv, iRank;
1499  iRank = geometry->PeriodicRecv2Neighbor[rank];
1500  iRecv = geometry->nPoint_PeriodicRecv[iRank]*countPerPeriodicPoint;
1501  myStart = nPoint_PeriodicSend[val_iSend]*countPerPeriodicPoint;
1502  myFinal = nPoint_PeriodicSend[val_iSend+1]*countPerPeriodicPoint;
1503  for (iSend = myStart; iSend < myFinal; iSend++) {
1504  switch (commType) {
1505  case COMM_TYPE_DOUBLE:
1506  bufD_PeriodicRecv[iRecv] = bufD_PeriodicSend[iSend];
1507  break;
1508  case COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_SHORT:
1509  bufS_PeriodicRecv[iRecv] = bufS_PeriodicSend[iSend];
1510  break;
1511  default:
1512  SU2_MPI::Error("Unrecognized data type for periodic MPI comms.",
1513  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1514  break;
1515  }
1516  iRecv++;
1517  }
1518 
1519 #endif
1520 
1521 }
1522 
1523 su2double CGeometry::Point2Plane_Distance(su2double *Coord, su2double *iCoord, su2double *jCoord, su2double *kCoord) {
1524  su2double CrossProduct[3], iVector[3], jVector[3], distance, modulus;
1525  unsigned short iDim;
1526 
1527  for (iDim = 0; iDim < 3; iDim ++) {
1528  iVector[iDim] = jCoord[iDim] - iCoord[iDim];
1529  jVector[iDim] = kCoord[iDim] - iCoord[iDim];
1530  }
1531 
1532  CrossProduct[0] = iVector[1]*jVector[2] - iVector[2]*jVector[1];
1533  CrossProduct[1] = iVector[2]*jVector[0] - iVector[0]*jVector[2];
1534  CrossProduct[2] = iVector[0]*jVector[1] - iVector[1]*jVector[0];
1535 
1536  modulus = sqrt(CrossProduct[0]*CrossProduct[0]+CrossProduct[1]*CrossProduct[1]+CrossProduct[2]*CrossProduct[2]);
1537 
1538  distance = 0.0;
1539  for (iDim = 0; iDim < 3; iDim ++)
1540  distance += CrossProduct[iDim]*(Coord[iDim]-iCoord[iDim]);
1541  distance /= modulus;
1542 
1543  return distance;
1544 
1545 }
1546 
1547 long CGeometry::FindEdge(unsigned long first_point, unsigned long second_point) {
1548  unsigned long iPoint = 0;
1549  unsigned short iNode;
1550  for (iNode = 0; iNode < node[first_point]->GetnPoint(); iNode++) {
1551  iPoint = node[first_point]->GetPoint(iNode);
1552  if (iPoint == second_point) break;
1553  }
1554 
1555  if (iPoint == second_point) return node[first_point]->GetEdge(iNode);
1556  else {
1557  char buf[100];
1558  SPRINTF(buf, "Can't find the edge that connects %lu and %lu.", first_point, second_point);
1559  SU2_MPI::Error(buf, CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1560  return 0;
1561  }
1562 }
1563 
1564 bool CGeometry::CheckEdge(unsigned long first_point, unsigned long second_point) {
1565  unsigned long iPoint = 0;
1566  unsigned short iNode;
1567  for (iNode = 0; iNode < node[first_point]->GetnPoint(); iNode++) {
1568  iPoint = node[first_point]->GetPoint(iNode);
1569  if (iPoint == second_point) break;
1570  }
1571 
1572  if (iPoint == second_point) return true;
1573  else return false;
1574 
1575 }
1576 
1577 void CGeometry::SetEdges(void) {
1578  unsigned long iPoint, jPoint;
1579  long iEdge;
1580  unsigned short jNode, iNode;
1581  long TestEdge = 0;
1582 
1583  nEdge = 0;
1584  for (iPoint = 0; iPoint < nPoint; iPoint++)
1585  for (iNode = 0; iNode < node[iPoint]->GetnPoint(); iNode++) {
1586  jPoint = node[iPoint]->GetPoint(iNode);
1587  for (jNode = 0; jNode < node[jPoint]->GetnPoint(); jNode++)
1588  if (node[jPoint]->GetPoint(jNode) == iPoint) {
1589  TestEdge = node[jPoint]->GetEdge(jNode);
1590  break;
1591  }
1592  if (TestEdge == -1) {
1593  node[iPoint]->SetEdge(nEdge, iNode);
1594  node[jPoint]->SetEdge(nEdge, jNode);
1595  nEdge++;
1596  }
1597  }
1598 
1599  edge = new CEdge*[nEdge];
1600 
1601  for (iPoint = 0; iPoint < nPoint; iPoint++)
1602  for (iNode = 0; iNode < node[iPoint]->GetnPoint(); iNode++) {
1603  jPoint = node[iPoint]->GetPoint(iNode);
1604  iEdge = FindEdge(iPoint, jPoint);
1605  if (iPoint < jPoint) edge[iEdge] = new CEdge(iPoint, jPoint, nDim);
1606  }
1607 }
1608

1616  // for (iNode = 0; iNode < node[iPoint]->GetnPoint(); iNode++) {

1618  // for (jNode = 0; jNode < node[jPoint]->GetnPoint(); jNode++)
1619  // if (node[jPoint]->GetPoint(jNode) == iPoint) {
1620  // TestFace = node[jPoint]->GetFace(jNode);
1621  // break;
1622  // }
1623  // if (TestFace == -1) {
1624  // node[iPoint]->SetFace(nFace, iNode);
1625  // node[jPoint]->SetFace(nFace, jNode);
1626  // nFace++;
1627  // }

1639 
1640 void CGeometry::TestGeometry(void) {
1641 
1642  ofstream para_file;
1643 
1644  para_file.open("test_geometry.dat", ios::out);
1645 
1646  su2double *Normal = new su2double[nDim];
1647 
1648  for (unsigned long iEdge = 0; iEdge < nEdge; iEdge++) {
1649  para_file << "Edge index: " << iEdge << endl;
1650  para_file << " Point index: " << edge[iEdge]->GetNode(0) << "\t" << edge[iEdge]->GetNode(1) << endl;
1651  edge[iEdge]->GetNormal(Normal);
1652  para_file << " Face normal : ";
1653  for (unsigned short iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; iDim++)
1654  para_file << Normal[iDim] << "\t";
1655  para_file << endl;
1656  }
1657 
1658  para_file << endl;
1659  para_file << endl;
1660  para_file << endl;
1661  para_file << endl;
1662 
1663  for (unsigned short iMarker =0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++) {
1664  para_file << "Marker index: " << iMarker << endl;
1665  for (unsigned long iVertex = 0; iVertex < nVertex[iMarker]; iVertex++) {
1666  para_file << " Vertex index: " << iVertex << endl;
1667  para_file << " Point index: " << vertex[iMarker][iVertex]->GetNode() << endl;
1668  para_file << " Point coordinates : ";
1669  for (unsigned short iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; iDim++) {
1670  para_file << node[vertex[iMarker][iVertex]->GetNode()]->GetCoord(iDim) << "\t";}
1671  para_file << endl;
1672  vertex[iMarker][iVertex]->GetNormal(Normal);
1673  para_file << " Face normal : ";
1674  for (unsigned short iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; iDim++)
1675  para_file << Normal[iDim] << "\t";
1676  para_file << endl;
1677  }
1678  }
1679 
1680  delete [] Normal;
1681 
1682 }
1683 
1684 void CGeometry::SetSpline(vector<su2double> &x, vector<su2double> &y, unsigned long n, su2double yp1, su2double ypn, vector<su2double> &y2) {
1685  unsigned long i, k;
1686  su2double p, qn, sig, un, *u;
1687 
1688  u = new su2double [n];
1689 
1690  if (yp1 > 0.99e30) // The lower boundary condition is set either to be "nat
1691  y2[0]=u[0]=0.0; // -ural"
1692  else { // or else to have a specified first derivative.
1693  y2[0] = -0.5;
1694  u[0]=(3.0/(x[1]-x[0]))*((y[1]-y[0])/(x[1]-x[0])-yp1);
1695  }
1696 
1697  for (i=2; i<=n-1; i++) { // This is the decomposition loop of the tridiagonal al-
1698  sig=(x[i-1]-x[i-2])/(x[i]-x[i-2]); // gorithm. y2 and u are used for tem-
1699  p=sig*y2[i-2]+2.0; // porary storage of the decomposed
1700  y2[i-1]=(sig-1.0)/p; // factors.
1701 
1702  su2double a1 = (y[i]-y[i-1])/(x[i]-x[i-1]); if (x[i] == x[i-1]) a1 = 1.0;
1703  su2double a2 = (y[i-1]-y[i-2])/(x[i-1]-x[i-2]); if (x[i-1] == x[i-2]) a2 = 1.0;
1704  u[i-1]= a1 - a2;
1705  u[i-1]=(6.0*u[i-1]/(x[i]-x[i-2])-sig*u[i-2])/p;
1706 
1707  }
1708 
1709  if (ypn > 0.99e30) // The upper boundary condition is set either to be
1710  qn=un=0.0; // "natural"
1711  else { // or else to have a specified first derivative.
1712  qn=0.5;
1713  un=(3.0/(x[n-1]-x[n-2]))*(ypn-(y[n-1]-y[n-2])/(x[n-1]-x[n-2]));
1714  }
1715  y2[n-1]=(un-qn*u[n-2])/(qn*y2[n-2]+1.0);
1716  for (k=n-1; k>=1; k--) // This is the backsubstitution loop of the tridiagonal
1717  y2[k-1]=y2[k-1]*y2[k]+u[k-1]; // algorithm.
1718 
1719  delete[] u;
1720 
1721 }
1722 
1723 su2double CGeometry::GetSpline(vector<su2double>&xa, vector<su2double>&ya, vector<su2double>&y2a, unsigned long n, su2double x) {
1724  unsigned long klo, khi, k;
1725  su2double h, b, a, y;
1726 
1727  if (x < xa[0]) x = xa[0]; // Clip max and min values
1728  if (x > xa[n-1]) x = xa[n-1];
1729 
1730  klo = 1; // We will find the right place in the table by means of
1731  khi = n; // bisection. This is optimal if sequential calls to this
1732  while (khi-klo > 1) { // routine are at random values of x. If sequential calls
1733  k = (khi+klo) >> 1; // are in order, and closely spaced, one would do better
1734  if (xa[k-1] > x) khi = k; // to store previous values of klo and khi and test if
1735  else klo=k; // they remain appropriate on the next call.
1736  } // klo and khi now bracket the input value of x
1737  h = xa[khi-1] - xa[klo-1];
1738  if (h == 0.0) h = EPS; // cout << "Bad xa input to routine splint" << endl; // The xa?s must be distinct.
1739  a = (xa[khi-1]-x)/h;
1740  b = (x-xa[klo-1])/h; // Cubic spline polynomial is now evaluated.
1741  y = a*ya[klo-1]+b*ya[khi-1]+((a*a*a-a)*y2a[klo-1]+(b*b*b-b)*y2a[khi-1])*(h*h)/6.0;
1742 
1743  return y;
1744 }
1745 
1746 bool CGeometry::SegmentIntersectsPlane(su2double *Segment_P0, su2double *Segment_P1, su2double Variable_P0, su2double Variable_P1,
1747  su2double *Plane_P0, su2double *Plane_Normal, su2double *Intersection, su2double &Variable_Interp) {
1748  su2double u[3], v[3], Denominator, Numerator, Aux, ModU;
1749  su2double epsilon = 1E-6; // An epsilon is added to eliminate, as much as possible, the posibility of a line that intersects a point
1750  unsigned short iDim;
1751 
1752  for (iDim = 0; iDim < 3; iDim++) {
1753  u[iDim] = Segment_P1[iDim] - Segment_P0[iDim];
1754  v[iDim] = (Plane_P0[iDim]+epsilon) - Segment_P0[iDim];
1755  }
1756 
1757  ModU = sqrt(u[0]*u[0]+u[1]*u[1]+u[2]*u[2]);
1758 
1759  Numerator = (Plane_Normal[0]+epsilon)*v[0] + (Plane_Normal[1]+epsilon)*v[1] + (Plane_Normal[2]+epsilon)*v[2];
1760  Denominator = (Plane_Normal[0]+epsilon)*u[0] + (Plane_Normal[1]+epsilon)*u[1] + (Plane_Normal[2]+epsilon)*u[2];
1761 
1762  if (fabs(Denominator) <= 0.0) return (false); // No intersection.
1763 
1764  Aux = Numerator / Denominator;
1765 
1766  if (Aux < 0.0 || Aux > 1.0) return (false); // No intersection.
1767 
1768  for (iDim = 0; iDim < 3; iDim++)
1769  Intersection[iDim] = Segment_P0[iDim] + Aux * u[iDim];
1770 
1771 
1772  /*--- Check that the intersection is in the segment ---*/
1773 
1774  for (iDim = 0; iDim < 3; iDim++) {
1775  u[iDim] = Segment_P0[iDim] - Intersection[iDim];
1776  v[iDim] = Segment_P1[iDim] - Intersection[iDim];
1777  }
1778 
1779  Variable_Interp = Variable_P0 + (Variable_P1 - Variable_P0)*sqrt(u[0]*u[0]+u[1]*u[1]+u[2]*u[2])/ModU;
1780 
1781  Denominator = (Plane_Normal[0]+epsilon)*u[0] + (Plane_Normal[1]+epsilon)*u[1] + (Plane_Normal[2]+epsilon)*u[2];
1782  Numerator = (Plane_Normal[0]+epsilon)*v[0] + (Plane_Normal[1]+epsilon)*v[1] + (Plane_Normal[2]+epsilon)*v[2];
1783 
1784  Aux = Numerator * Denominator;
1785 
1786  if (Aux > 0.0) return (false); // Intersection outside the segment.
1787 
1788  return (true);
1789 
1790 }
1791 
1792 bool CGeometry::RayIntersectsTriangle(su2double orig[3], su2double dir[3],
1793  su2double vert0[3], su2double vert1[3], su2double vert2[3],
1794  su2double *intersect) {
1795 
1796  su2double edge1[3], edge2[3], tvec[3], pvec[3], qvec[3];
1797  su2double det, inv_det, t, u, v;
1798 
1799  /*--- Find vectors for two edges sharing vert0 ---*/
1800 
1801  SUB(edge1, vert1, vert0);
1802  SUB(edge2, vert2, vert0);
1803 
1804  /*--- Begin calculating determinant - also used to calculate U parameter ---*/
1805 
1806  CROSS(pvec, dir, edge2);
1807 
1808  /*--- If determinant is near zero, ray lies in plane of triangle ---*/
1809 
1810  det = DOT(edge1, pvec);
1811 
1812 
1813  if (det > -EPSILON && det < EPSILON) return(false);
1814 
1815  inv_det = 1.0 / det;
1816 
1817  /*--- Calculate distance from vert0 to ray origin ---*/
1818 
1819  SUB(tvec, orig, vert0);
1820 
1821  /*--- Calculate U parameter and test bounds ---*/
1822 
1823  u = inv_det * DOT(tvec, pvec);
1824 
1825  if (u < 0.0 || u > 1.0) return(false);
1826 
1827  /*--- prepare to test V parameter ---*/
1828 
1829  CROSS(qvec, tvec, edge1);
1830 
1831  /*--- Calculate V parameter and test bounds ---*/
1832 
1833  v = inv_det * DOT(dir, qvec);
1834 
1835  if (v < 0.0 || u + v > 1.0) return(false);
1836 
1837  /*--- Calculate t, ray intersects triangle ---*/
1838 
1839  t = inv_det * DOT(edge2, qvec);
1840 
1841  /*--- Compute the intersection point in cartesian coordinates ---*/
1842 
1843  intersect[0] = orig[0] + (t * dir[0]);
1844  intersect[1] = orig[1] + (t * dir[1]);
1845  intersect[2] = orig[2] + (t * dir[2]);
1846 
1847  return (true);
1848 
1849 }
1850 
1851 bool CGeometry::SegmentIntersectsLine(su2double point0[2], su2double point1[2], su2double vert0[2], su2double vert1[2]) {
1852 
1853  su2double det, diff0_A, diff0_B, diff1_A, diff1_B, intersect[2];
1854 
1855  diff0_A = point0[0] - point1[0];
1856  diff1_A = point0[1] - point1[1];
1857 
1858  diff0_B = vert0[0] - vert1[0];
1859  diff1_B = vert0[1] - vert1[1];
1860 
1861  det = (diff0_A)*(diff1_B) - (diff1_A)*(diff0_B);
1862 
1863  if (det == 0) return false;
1864 
1865  /*--- Compute point of intersection ---*/
1866 
1867  intersect[0] = ((point0[0]*point1[1] - point0[1]*point1[0])*diff0_B
1868  -(vert0[0]* vert1[1] - vert0[1]* vert1[0])*diff0_A)/det;
1869 
1870  intersect[1] = ((point0[0]*point1[1] - point0[1]*point1[0])*diff1_B
1871  -(vert0[0]* vert1[1] - vert0[1]* vert1[0])*diff1_A)/det;
1872 
1873 
1874  /*--- Check that the point is between the two surface points ---*/
1875 
1876  su2double dist0, dist1, length;
1877 
1878  dist0 = (intersect[0] - point0[0])*(intersect[0] - point0[0])
1879  +(intersect[1] - point0[1])*(intersect[1] - point0[1]);
1880 
1881  dist1 = (intersect[0] - point1[0])*(intersect[0] - point1[0])
1882  +(intersect[1] - point1[1])*(intersect[1] - point1[1]);
1883 
1884  length = diff0_A*diff0_A
1885  +diff1_A*diff1_A;
1886 
1887  if ( (dist0 > length) || (dist1 > length) ) {
1888  return false;
1889  }
1890 
1891  return true;
1892 }
1893 
1894 bool CGeometry::SegmentIntersectsTriangle(su2double point0[3], su2double point1[3],
1895  su2double vert0[3], su2double vert1[3], su2double vert2[3]) {
1896 
1897  su2double dir[3], intersect[3], u[3], v[3], edge1[3], edge2[3], Plane_Normal[3], Denominator, Numerator, Aux;
1898 
1899  SUB(dir, point1, point0);
1900 
1901  if (RayIntersectsTriangle(point0, dir, vert0, vert1, vert2, intersect)) {
1902 
1903  /*--- Check that the intersection is in the segment ---*/
1904 
1905  SUB(u, point0, intersect);
1906  SUB(v, point1, intersect);
1907 
1908  SUB(edge1, vert1, vert0);
1909  SUB(edge2, vert2, vert0);
1910  CROSS(Plane_Normal, edge1, edge2);
1911 
1912  Denominator = DOT(Plane_Normal, u);
1913  Numerator = DOT(Plane_Normal, v);
1914 
1915  Aux = Numerator * Denominator;
1916 
1917  /*--- Intersection outside the segment ---*/
1918 
1919  if (Aux > 0.0) return (false);
1920 
1921  }
1922  else {
1923 
1924  /*--- No intersection with the ray ---*/
1925 
1926  return (false);
1927 
1928  }
1929 
1930  /*--- Intersection inside the segment ---*/
1931 
1932  return (true);
1933 
1934 }
1935 
1936 void CGeometry::ComputeAirfoil_Section(su2double *Plane_P0, su2double *Plane_Normal,
1937  su2double MinXCoord, su2double MaxXCoord,
1938  su2double MinYCoord, su2double MaxYCoord,
1939  su2double MinZCoord, su2double MaxZCoord,
1940  su2double *FlowVariable,
1941  vector<su2double> &Xcoord_Airfoil, vector<su2double> &Ycoord_Airfoil,
1942  vector<su2double> &Zcoord_Airfoil, vector<su2double> &Variable_Airfoil,
1943  bool original_surface, CConfig *config) {
1944 
1945  AD_BEGIN_PASSIVE
1946 
1947  unsigned short iMarker, iNode, jNode, iDim, Index = 0;
1948  bool intersect;
1949  long Next_Edge = 0;
1950  unsigned long iPoint, jPoint, iElem, Trailing_Point, Airfoil_Point, iVertex, iEdge, PointIndex, jEdge;
1951  su2double Segment_P0[3] = {0.0, 0.0, 0.0}, Segment_P1[3] = {0.0, 0.0, 0.0}, Variable_P0 = 0.0, Variable_P1 = 0.0, Intersection[3] = {0.0, 0.0, 0.0}, Trailing_Coord,
1952  *VarCoord = NULL, Variable_Interp, v1[3] = {0.0, 0.0, 0.0}, v3[3] = {0.0, 0.0, 0.0}, CrossProduct = 1.0;
1953  bool Found_Edge;
1954  passivedouble Dist_Value;
1955  vector<su2double> Xcoord_Index0, Ycoord_Index0, Zcoord_Index0, Variable_Index0, Xcoord_Index1, Ycoord_Index1, Zcoord_Index1, Variable_Index1;
1956  vector<unsigned long> IGlobalID_Index0, JGlobalID_Index0, IGlobalID_Index1, JGlobalID_Index1, IGlobalID_Airfoil, JGlobalID_Airfoil;
1957  vector<unsigned short> Conection_Index0, Conection_Index1;
1958  vector<unsigned long> Duplicate;
1959  vector<unsigned long>::iterator it;
1960  su2double **Coord_Variation = NULL;
1961  vector<su2double> XcoordExtra, YcoordExtra, ZcoordExtra, VariableExtra;
1962  vector<unsigned long> IGlobalIDExtra, JGlobalIDExtra;
1963  vector<bool> AddExtra;
1964  unsigned long EdgeDonor;
1965  bool FoundEdge;
1966 
1967 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
1968  unsigned long nLocalEdge, MaxLocalEdge, *Buffer_Send_nEdge, *Buffer_Receive_nEdge, nBuffer_Coord, nBuffer_Variable, nBuffer_GlobalID;
1969  int nProcessor, iProcessor;
1970  su2double *Buffer_Send_Coord, *Buffer_Receive_Coord;
1971  su2double *Buffer_Send_Variable, *Buffer_Receive_Variable;
1972  unsigned long *Buffer_Send_GlobalID, *Buffer_Receive_GlobalID;
1973 #endif
1974 
1975  Xcoord_Airfoil.clear();
1976  Ycoord_Airfoil.clear();
1977  Zcoord_Airfoil.clear();
1978  Variable_Airfoil.clear();
1979  IGlobalID_Airfoil.clear();
1980  JGlobalID_Airfoil.clear();
1981 
1982  /*--- Set the right plane in 2D (note the change in Y-Z plane) ---*/
1983 
1984  if (nDim == 2) {
1985  Plane_P0[0] = 0.0; Plane_P0[1] = 0.0; Plane_P0[2] = 0.0;
1986  Plane_Normal[0] = 0.0; Plane_Normal[1] = 1.0; Plane_Normal[2] = 0.0;
1987  }
1988 
1989  /*--- Grid movement is stored using a vertices information,
1990  we should go from vertex to points ---*/
1991 
1992  if (original_surface == false) {
1993 
1994  Coord_Variation = new su2double *[nPoint];
1995  for (iPoint = 0; iPoint < nPoint; iPoint++)
1996  Coord_Variation[iPoint] = new su2double [nDim];
1997 
1998  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < config->GetnMarker_All(); iMarker++) {
1999  if (config->GetMarker_All_GeoEval(iMarker) == YES) {
2000  for (iVertex = 0; iVertex < nVertex[iMarker]; iVertex++) {
2001  VarCoord = vertex[iMarker][iVertex]->GetVarCoord();
2002  iPoint = vertex[iMarker][iVertex]->GetNode();
2003  for (iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; iDim++)
2004  Coord_Variation[iPoint][iDim] = VarCoord[iDim];
2005  }
2006  }
2007  }
2008 
2009  }
2010 
2011  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++) {
2012 
2013  if (config->GetMarker_All_GeoEval(iMarker) == YES) {
2014 
2015  for (iElem = 0; iElem < nElem_Bound[iMarker]; iElem++) {
2016 
2017  PointIndex=0;
2018 
2019  /*--- To decide if an element is going to be used or not should be done element based,
2020  The first step is to compute and average coordinate for the element ---*/
2021 
2022  su2double AveXCoord = 0.0;
2023  su2double AveYCoord = 0.0;
2024  su2double AveZCoord = 0.0;
2025 
2026  for (iNode = 0; iNode < bound[iMarker][iElem]->GetnNodes(); iNode++) {
2027  iPoint = bound[iMarker][iElem]->GetNode(iNode);
2028  AveXCoord += node[iPoint]->GetCoord(0);
2029  AveYCoord += node[iPoint]->GetCoord(1);
2030  if (nDim == 3) AveZCoord += node[iPoint]->GetCoord(2);
2031  }
2032 
2033  AveXCoord /= su2double(bound[iMarker][iElem]->GetnNodes());
2034  AveYCoord /= su2double(bound[iMarker][iElem]->GetnNodes());
2035  AveZCoord /= su2double(bound[iMarker][iElem]->GetnNodes());
2036 
2037  /*--- To only cut one part of the nacelle based on the cross product
2038  of the normal to the plane and a vector that connect the point
2039  with the center line ---*/
2040 
2041  CrossProduct = 1.0;
2042 
2043  if (config->GetGeo_Description() == NACELLE) {
2044 
2045  su2double Tilt_Angle = config->GetNacelleLocation(3)*PI_NUMBER/180;
2046  su2double Toe_Angle = config->GetNacelleLocation(4)*PI_NUMBER/180;
2047 
2048  /*--- Translate to the origin ---*/
2049 
2050  su2double XCoord_Trans = AveXCoord - config->GetNacelleLocation(0);
2051  su2double YCoord_Trans = AveYCoord - config->GetNacelleLocation(1);
2052  su2double ZCoord_Trans = AveZCoord - config->GetNacelleLocation(2);
2053 
2054  /*--- Apply tilt angle ---*/
2055 
2056  su2double XCoord_Trans_Tilt = XCoord_Trans*cos(Tilt_Angle) + ZCoord_Trans*sin(Tilt_Angle);
2057  su2double YCoord_Trans_Tilt = YCoord_Trans;
2058  su2double ZCoord_Trans_Tilt = ZCoord_Trans*cos(Tilt_Angle) - XCoord_Trans*sin(Tilt_Angle);
2059 
2060  /*--- Apply toe angle ---*/
2061 
2062  su2double YCoord_Trans_Tilt_Toe = XCoord_Trans_Tilt*sin(Toe_Angle) + YCoord_Trans_Tilt*cos(Toe_Angle);
2063  su2double ZCoord_Trans_Tilt_Toe = ZCoord_Trans_Tilt;
2064 
2065  /*--- Undo plane rotation, we have already rotated the nacelle ---*/
2066 
2067  /*--- Undo tilt angle ---*/
2068 
2069  su2double XPlane_Normal_Tilt = Plane_Normal[0]*cos(-Tilt_Angle) + Plane_Normal[2]*sin(-Tilt_Angle);
2070  su2double YPlane_Normal_Tilt = Plane_Normal[1];
2071  su2double ZPlane_Normal_Tilt = Plane_Normal[2]*cos(-Tilt_Angle) - Plane_Normal[0]*sin(-Tilt_Angle);
2072 
2073  /*--- Undo toe angle ---*/
2074 
2075  su2double YPlane_Normal_Tilt_Toe = XPlane_Normal_Tilt*sin(-Toe_Angle) + YPlane_Normal_Tilt*cos(-Toe_Angle);
2076  su2double ZPlane_Normal_Tilt_Toe = ZPlane_Normal_Tilt;
2077 
2078 
2079  v1[1] = YCoord_Trans_Tilt_Toe - 0.0;
2080  v1[2] = ZCoord_Trans_Tilt_Toe - 0.0;
2081  v3[0] = v1[1]*ZPlane_Normal_Tilt_Toe-v1[2]*YPlane_Normal_Tilt_Toe;
2082  CrossProduct = v3[0] * 1.0;
2083 
2084  }
2085 
2086  for (iNode = 0; iNode < bound[iMarker][iElem]->GetnNodes(); iNode++) {
2087  iPoint = bound[iMarker][iElem]->GetNode(iNode);
2088 
2089  for (jNode = 0; jNode < bound[iMarker][iElem]->GetnNodes(); jNode++) {
2090  jPoint = bound[iMarker][iElem]->GetNode(jNode);
2091 
2092  /*--- CrossProduct concept is delicated because it allows triangles where only one side is divided by a plane.
2093  that is going against the concept that all the triangles are divided twice and causes probelms because
2094  Xcoord_Index0.size() > Xcoord_Index1.size()! ---*/
2095 
2096  if ((jPoint > iPoint) && (CrossProduct >= 0.0)
2097  && ((AveXCoord > MinXCoord) && (AveXCoord < MaxXCoord))
2098  && ((AveYCoord > MinYCoord) && (AveYCoord < MaxYCoord))
2099  && ((AveZCoord > MinZCoord) && (AveZCoord < MaxZCoord))) {
2100 
2101  Segment_P0[0] = 0.0; Segment_P0[1] = 0.0; Segment_P0[2] = 0.0; Variable_P0 = 0.0;
2102  Segment_P1[0] = 0.0; Segment_P1[1] = 0.0; Segment_P1[2] = 0.0; Variable_P1 = 0.0;
2103 
2104 
2105  for (iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; iDim++) {
2106  if (original_surface == true) {
2107  Segment_P0[iDim] = node[iPoint]->GetCoord(iDim);
2108  Segment_P1[iDim] = node[jPoint]->GetCoord(iDim);
2109  }
2110  else {
2111  Segment_P0[iDim] = node[iPoint]->GetCoord(iDim) + Coord_Variation[iPoint][iDim];
2112  Segment_P1[iDim] = node[jPoint]->GetCoord(iDim) + Coord_Variation[jPoint][iDim];
2113  }
2114  }
2115 
2116  if (FlowVariable != NULL) {
2117  Variable_P0 = FlowVariable[iPoint];
2118  Variable_P1 = FlowVariable[jPoint];
2119  }
2120 
2121  /*--- In 2D add the points directly (note the change between Y and Z coordinate) ---*/
2122 
2123  if (nDim == 2) {
2124  Xcoord_Index0.push_back(Segment_P0[0]); Xcoord_Index1.push_back(Segment_P1[0]);
2125  Ycoord_Index0.push_back(Segment_P0[2]); Ycoord_Index1.push_back(Segment_P1[2]);
2126  Zcoord_Index0.push_back(Segment_P0[1]); Zcoord_Index1.push_back(Segment_P1[1]);
2127  Variable_Index0.push_back(Variable_P0); Variable_Index1.push_back(Variable_P1);
2128  IGlobalID_Index0.push_back(node[iPoint]->GetGlobalIndex()); IGlobalID_Index1.push_back(node[jPoint]->GetGlobalIndex());
2129  JGlobalID_Index0.push_back(node[iPoint]->GetGlobalIndex()); JGlobalID_Index1.push_back(node[jPoint]->GetGlobalIndex());
2130  PointIndex++;
2131  }
2132 
2133  /*--- In 3D compute the intersection ---*/
2134 
2135  else if (nDim == 3) {
2136  intersect = SegmentIntersectsPlane(Segment_P0, Segment_P1, Variable_P0, Variable_P1, Plane_P0, Plane_Normal, Intersection, Variable_Interp);
2137  if (intersect == true) {
2138  if (PointIndex == 0) {
2139  Xcoord_Index0.push_back(Intersection[0]);
2140  Ycoord_Index0.push_back(Intersection[1]);
2141  Zcoord_Index0.push_back(Intersection[2]);
2142  Variable_Index0.push_back(Variable_Interp);
2143  IGlobalID_Index0.push_back(node[iPoint]->GetGlobalIndex());
2144  JGlobalID_Index0.push_back(node[jPoint]->GetGlobalIndex());
2145  }
2146  if (PointIndex == 1) {
2147  Xcoord_Index1.push_back(Intersection[0]);
2148  Ycoord_Index1.push_back(Intersection[1]);
2149  Zcoord_Index1.push_back(Intersection[2]);
2150  Variable_Index1.push_back(Variable_Interp);
2151  IGlobalID_Index1.push_back(node[iPoint]->GetGlobalIndex());
2152  JGlobalID_Index1.push_back(node[jPoint]->GetGlobalIndex());
2153  }
2154  PointIndex++;
2155  }
2156  }
2157 
2158  }
2159  }
2160  }
2161 
2162  }
2163  }
2164  }
2165 
2166  if (original_surface == false) {
2167  for (iPoint = 0; iPoint < nPoint; iPoint++)
2168  delete [] Coord_Variation[iPoint];
2169  delete [] Coord_Variation;
2170  }
2171 
2172 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
2173 
2174  /*--- Copy the coordinates of all the points in the plane to the master node ---*/
2175 
2176  nLocalEdge = 0, MaxLocalEdge = 0;
2177  nProcessor = size;
2178 
2179  Buffer_Send_nEdge = new unsigned long [1];
2180  Buffer_Receive_nEdge = new unsigned long [nProcessor];
2181 
2182  nLocalEdge = Xcoord_Index0.size();
2183 
2184  Buffer_Send_nEdge[0] = nLocalEdge;
2185 
2186  SU2_MPI::Allreduce(&nLocalEdge, &MaxLocalEdge, 1, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, MPI_MAX, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
2187  SU2_MPI::Allgather(Buffer_Send_nEdge, 1, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, Buffer_Receive_nEdge, 1, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
2188 
2189  Buffer_Send_Coord = new su2double [MaxLocalEdge*6];
2190  Buffer_Receive_Coord = new su2double [nProcessor*MaxLocalEdge*6];
2191 
2192  Buffer_Send_Variable = new su2double [MaxLocalEdge*2];
2193  Buffer_Receive_Variable = new su2double [nProcessor*MaxLocalEdge*2];
2194 
2195  Buffer_Send_GlobalID = new unsigned long [MaxLocalEdge*4];
2196  Buffer_Receive_GlobalID = new unsigned long [nProcessor*MaxLocalEdge*4];
2197 
2198  nBuffer_Coord = MaxLocalEdge*6;
2199  nBuffer_Variable = MaxLocalEdge*2;
2200  nBuffer_GlobalID = MaxLocalEdge*4;
2201 
2202  for (iEdge = 0; iEdge < nLocalEdge; iEdge++) {
2203  Buffer_Send_Coord[iEdge*6 + 0] = Xcoord_Index0[iEdge];
2204  Buffer_Send_Coord[iEdge*6 + 1] = Ycoord_Index0[iEdge];
2205  Buffer_Send_Coord[iEdge*6 + 2] = Zcoord_Index0[iEdge];
2206  Buffer_Send_Coord[iEdge*6 + 3] = Xcoord_Index1[iEdge];
2207  Buffer_Send_Coord[iEdge*6 + 4] = Ycoord_Index1[iEdge];
2208  Buffer_Send_Coord[iEdge*6 + 5] = Zcoord_Index1[iEdge];
2209 
2210  Buffer_Send_Variable[iEdge*2 + 0] = Variable_Index0[iEdge];
2211  Buffer_Send_Variable[iEdge*2 + 1] = Variable_Index1[iEdge];
2212 
2213  Buffer_Send_GlobalID[iEdge*4 + 0] = IGlobalID_Index0[iEdge];
2214  Buffer_Send_GlobalID[iEdge*4 + 1] = JGlobalID_Index0[iEdge];
2215  Buffer_Send_GlobalID[iEdge*4 + 2] = IGlobalID_Index1[iEdge];
2216  Buffer_Send_GlobalID[iEdge*4 + 3] = JGlobalID_Index1[iEdge];
2217  }
2218 
2219  SU2_MPI::Allgather(Buffer_Send_Coord, nBuffer_Coord, MPI_DOUBLE, Buffer_Receive_Coord, nBuffer_Coord, MPI_DOUBLE, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
2220  SU2_MPI::Allgather(Buffer_Send_Variable, nBuffer_Variable, MPI_DOUBLE, Buffer_Receive_Variable, nBuffer_Variable, MPI_DOUBLE, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
2221  SU2_MPI::Allgather(Buffer_Send_GlobalID, nBuffer_GlobalID, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, Buffer_Receive_GlobalID, nBuffer_GlobalID, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
2222 
2223  /*--- Clean the vectors before adding the new vertices only to the master node ---*/
2224 
2225  Xcoord_Index0.clear(); Xcoord_Index1.clear();
2226  Ycoord_Index0.clear(); Ycoord_Index1.clear();
2227  Zcoord_Index0.clear(); Zcoord_Index1.clear();
2228  Variable_Index0.clear(); Variable_Index1.clear();
2229  IGlobalID_Index0.clear(); IGlobalID_Index1.clear();
2230  JGlobalID_Index0.clear(); JGlobalID_Index1.clear();
2231 
2232  /*--- Copy the boundary to the master node vectors ---*/
2233 
2234  if (rank == MASTER_NODE) {
2235  for (iProcessor = 0; iProcessor < nProcessor; iProcessor++) {
2236  for (iEdge = 0; iEdge < Buffer_Receive_nEdge[iProcessor]; iEdge++) {
2237  Xcoord_Index0.push_back( Buffer_Receive_Coord[ iProcessor*MaxLocalEdge*6 + iEdge*6 + 0] );
2238  Ycoord_Index0.push_back( Buffer_Receive_Coord[ iProcessor*MaxLocalEdge*6 + iEdge*6 + 1] );
2239  Zcoord_Index0.push_back( Buffer_Receive_Coord[ iProcessor*MaxLocalEdge*6 + iEdge*6 + 2] );
2240  Xcoord_Index1.push_back( Buffer_Receive_Coord[ iProcessor*MaxLocalEdge*6 + iEdge*6 + 3] );
2241  Ycoord_Index1.push_back( Buffer_Receive_Coord[ iProcessor*MaxLocalEdge*6 + iEdge*6 + 4] );
2242  Zcoord_Index1.push_back( Buffer_Receive_Coord[ iProcessor*MaxLocalEdge*6 + iEdge*6 + 5] );
2243 
2244  Variable_Index0.push_back( Buffer_Receive_Variable[ iProcessor*MaxLocalEdge*2 + iEdge*2 + 0] );
2245  Variable_Index1.push_back( Buffer_Receive_Variable[ iProcessor*MaxLocalEdge*2 + iEdge*2 + 1] );
2246 
2247  IGlobalID_Index0.push_back( Buffer_Receive_GlobalID[ iProcessor*MaxLocalEdge*4 + iEdge*4 + 0] );
2248  JGlobalID_Index0.push_back( Buffer_Receive_GlobalID[ iProcessor*MaxLocalEdge*4 + iEdge*4 + 1] );
2249  IGlobalID_Index1.push_back( Buffer_Receive_GlobalID[ iProcessor*MaxLocalEdge*4 + iEdge*4 + 2] );
2250  JGlobalID_Index1.push_back( Buffer_Receive_GlobalID[ iProcessor*MaxLocalEdge*4 + iEdge*4 + 3] );
2251 
2252  }
2253  }
2254  }
2255 
2256  delete[] Buffer_Send_Coord; delete[] Buffer_Receive_Coord;
2257  delete[] Buffer_Send_Variable; delete[] Buffer_Receive_Variable;
2258  delete[] Buffer_Send_GlobalID; delete[] Buffer_Receive_GlobalID;
2259  delete[] Buffer_Send_nEdge; delete[] Buffer_Receive_nEdge;
2260 
2261 #endif
2262 
2263  if ((rank == MASTER_NODE) && (Xcoord_Index0.size() != 0)) {
2264 
2265  /*--- Remove singular edges ---*/
2266 
2267  bool Remove;
2268 
2269  do { Remove = false;
2270  for (iEdge = 0; iEdge < Xcoord_Index0.size(); iEdge++) {
2271 
2272  if (((IGlobalID_Index0[iEdge] == IGlobalID_Index1[iEdge]) && (JGlobalID_Index0[iEdge] == JGlobalID_Index1[iEdge])) ||
2273  ((IGlobalID_Index0[iEdge] == JGlobalID_Index1[iEdge]) && (JGlobalID_Index0[iEdge] == IGlobalID_Index1[iEdge]))) {
2274 
2275  Xcoord_Index0.erase (Xcoord_Index0.begin() + iEdge);
2276  Ycoord_Index0.erase (Ycoord_Index0.begin() + iEdge);
2277  Zcoord_Index0.erase (Zcoord_Index0.begin() + iEdge);
2278  Variable_Index0.erase (Variable_Index0.begin() + iEdge);
2279  IGlobalID_Index0.erase (IGlobalID_Index0.begin() + iEdge);
2280  JGlobalID_Index0.erase (JGlobalID_Index0.begin() + iEdge);
2281 
2282  Xcoord_Index1.erase (Xcoord_Index1.begin() + iEdge);
2283  Ycoord_Index1.erase (Ycoord_Index1.begin() + iEdge);
